snippet: A South Korean-born American entrepreneur, nominated to be minister of education, science and technology, withdrew on Monday, blaming political gridlock.
abstract: Jeong H Kim, South Korean-born American business executive who was nominated by Pres Park Geun-hye to be minister of future creation and science, withdraws, blaming political gridlock that has delayed his confirmation hearing in National Assembly.
lead_paragraph: A South Korean-born American entrepreneur, nominated to be minister of education, science and technology, withdrew on Monday, blaming political gridlock.

headline.seo: U.S. Executive Will No Longer Seek Seoul Cabinet Post
headline.main: American Won’t Join South Korea Cabinet
headline.print_headline: American Ends Bid for Seoul Cabinet
